reviews.text: Honestly - its terrible. The staff absolutely couldnt care less. If im ever there again I will absolutely try my luck sleeping in the airport departure loounge. Terrible rooms, rude staff & dodgyg location after dark.. Give it a miss.
reviews.title: Bite your arm off before staying here

reviews.text: Booked this hotel for its proximity to the Europa Bus Station which is adjacent. We were attending a concert at the Waterfront Hall and this is about 15-20 minutes walk away, so pretty convenient.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

likes.liked: — Location, friendly staff and spacious room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was friendly and helpful, we wanted information on Taxi tours of Belfast and she offered to contact the taxi company , it was as easy as that. The tour took in visits to the Falls Road and Shankill areas and the driver was very knowledgeable . He gave us a very interesting history of the Troubles and detail of today's position between the communities.
reviews.title: What more do you need!

reviews.text: We had a non-smoking room as reserved and this was a very spacious and well appointed room, above expectations. It was also very quiet, as was the hotel in other areas. The breakfast was a full buffet and was good quality.
reviews.title: Not the best hotel I've ever stayed in (Satisfactory)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Crown Bar is just across the street and is well worth a visit although it has scaffolding round it just now . The inside is pretty special and food is available upstairs.
reviews.title: Great Value for Money!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night - and would return. Clean and central - functional with no extras.
reviews.title: reception staff
Close to Belfast City centre
reviews.text: However the staff on reception were not very friendly - and booked us in to a smoking room although we had requested non smoking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was changed
reviews.title: Nice situation but...

likes.liked: — closeness o the town and easy access from the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked in at 2.30 in the afternoon - and were obviously a nuisance as there were no rooms ready.
reviews.title: Good value for the money.

likes.liked: — It's clean and comfortable. Did I mention that it's CLEAN?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this is a travel lodge type hotel - found that difficult to understand.
reviews.title: Perfect for a central location in Belfast!!!

likes.liked: — Value for money and central location with complimentary parking!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the first time I have rated Days hotel in Belfast, although I have stayed here several times over the past couple of years. Obviously we keep coming back for the simple reason that you get a really decent hotel for a really decent price. We usually pay around £65 for a double with breakfast.
reviews.title: A central hotel with all you need!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have always booked online and found the reception staff very courteous and friendly. There is a small bar and seating area, with newspapers etc. The breakfasts are good, although on the weekend, if you have a lie-in, then you risk a big queue! They have the usual Ulster fry, along with fresh fruits, yoghurts, breads in fact they provide everything for even the largest of appetites.
reviews.title: Good basic hotel for a brief stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite spacious with modern decor, the beds, comfortable with lovely crisp clean sheets and duvets. The housekeeping staff are more than good at their jobs! You also get free carparking in the main carpark to the side of the hotel, just keep the ticket so reception can validate it.
reviews.title: Great locaion to explore a changing city

reviews.text: The hotel is so central to the main areas of Belfast and is just across the street from Victoria bus/rail station. It is within walking distance to many of Belfasts wonderful bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Forget about the views - Its the location
Would stay here again...
reviews.text: Yes you could stay in the Europa which is just around the corner, but why pay £100 more per night?? It is unfortunate that some people were unrowdy in the bar (according to another review), but this should not take away from the fact that this is a modern, clean and well priced hotel that is in a great central location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Days Hotel for one night and the hotel itself was good, clean & comfortable, with a great buffet breakfast in the morning. The only small gripe we had was it was a bit of a hike to the centre of town compared with other hotels, especially as we walked to and from the Odessey Arena (to see Take That). Very weary legs at the end of the night (fantastic TT show though).
reviews.title: Great hotel apart from location

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for two nights, the hotel is clean and the rooms spacious, the hotel is in a good location, it was a 10 minute walk to the shops and city hall.
reviews.title: Clean, well located hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The area where the hotel is situated is fine and I felt very safe, yes there is still evidence of the troubles still there, but any one who goes to Belfast KNOWS this and it should not spoil your visit the people are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend the city bus tour £11 for adults, the tour is for 1 hour and 40 minutes and is very interesting.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Go to Belfast and enjoy ,and stay at the Days Hotel, it's worth it.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
